@rkivesyoongi All this time I thought Tear was the perfect anthem for pain of love gone wrong & how hard you try to hold it together when everything is tearing you apart; the longing to be back together, the regret for mistakes, the anger at the feeling of responsibility to make it all work.ðŸ˜­

@LeniiBlue No, not the sense of heaviness but pain in lungs when I coughed or took a deep breath. I did have tingling feeling in lower jaw and face and painful dry eyes. Monitor your breathing. That's the important thing!!

@hobiskiss Don't delay your mammogram! This happened to me in 2012. I had skipped a year but finally went in when there was generalized pain in my right breast - but no lump. They did a biopsy the same day as the mammogram, then surgery & treatment. I am 100% cancer free now. Sending ðŸ’œðŸ’œ
@stessieT I still remember how much I loved the smell of our local library in Washington D.C. !!

@holly_bourneYA I kept testing with my favorite strong taste, Wilkins Ginger marmalade. After 14 days still couldn't taste it but then  could smell a bit of garlic cooking. It's slowly coming back. It still has a way to go. It's like the 'center of the watermelon' full taste is still missing.

@GillCabrit @SadieR1978 @holly_bourneYA I can relate to that 'chemical smoke smell' too! It was sort of metallic, like an electrical fire. Really gross. I kept rinsing my  mouth out with strong anti-bacterial mouthwash but  couldn't taste it. Then the metallic taste came back. I lost 100% taste & smell for 14 days.

I cannot recommend this critically instructive Asian Boss video enough! He interviews the head of infectious diseases doctor about COVID-19. Just as a side note, the unique symptoms of loss of taste & smell mentioned at minute 14:11 are my symptoms too. https://t.co/wVUV3hEeEV

@DrMattMcCarthy And we are WAY WAY behind not only on testing but on getting results! I've been sick for 2 weeks with all the classic symptoms plus more (loss of smell & Taste) & I was tested last Thursday - a week ago - still haven't received results! We are so far behind where we should be.

@SkyNews @ENT_UK This has definitely been a strong symptom of mine for the past week. I cannot smell or taste anything at all. Got tested yesterday but have been told it could be 7-10 days for results. Labs are that backed up.

@sigur_lilja Not getting better at all. Everything is the same, day after day, with no improvement at all. The article this morning really caught my attention because I've lost ALL sense of taste and smell since last Sunday. It is SO weird. Now being told at least 7 days for test results.
@ENT_UK @bizteachroz This is me!  I've been sick since March 11 and the weirdest part of it is a complete loss of sense of smell and taste!
@unotaehyung Root Beer.  Got very sick on it after a hot day at the beach when I was five years old. Even the smell of it now makes me feel ill. Yuck!

@beautywhereyou1 @BTS_twt are so slender, so muscular. Oh wow, their skin is incredible - and you finally believe what you've heard before - that the boys are even better looking in real life. You become astonished at the passion and energy radiating off the stage. Even the solos take your breath away.+

@stessieT @BTS_twt Waking up to find my 6 month old Tabby kitten purring in my face and then reaching for my phone right away to check up on @BTS_twt news. THEN coffee and open the front door for a huge breath of cold fresh air. My morning happiness!

There are blessings in these tough times (in addition to full recovery from COVID-19 ..Yay!). My 50th high school reunion in D.C. was cancelled but 49 girls out of our class of 70 just had a 2 1/2 hr Zoom session & it was the best thing ever!! Actual reunion rescheduled for 2021.

@BTSArmyMom3 I left home twice after self-isolating on March 10 - the 1st time to go get tested for COVID-19 because I was so darn sick (yup, it was positive) & the second time to get more cough medicine on April 10. I've ordered groceries delivered & now starting to walk because I feel well.
So happy to see my weird COVID-19 symptom finally getting attention! https://t.co/UL6VyPxOBP https://t.co/xOeUQGnNHM

@pumpkjins Hang tough. I've been COVID-19 positive and it was three very yucky weeks. Watch for weird symptoms like sudden loss of taste. Track how you feel each day. Take your temp. Just know I NEVER had a fever, not once - or a sore throat, just really bad cough, chills, aches, exhaustion

Just want you all to know that I tested positive for COVID-19 but starting to feel much better after 2 really bad weeks. Probably caught it after long hours in The Denver airport on March 5th. Strangest symptom was complete loss of sense of taste. Stay well & vigilant everyone.ðŸ’œ
